remedies.Tomato_Bacterial_spot: Remove infected leaves, avoid overhead watering, and spray Copper Oxychloride (3g/L) or Streptocycline (100mg/L) + Copper Oxychloride (2.5g/L) every 10 days.
remedies.Tomato_Early_blight: Spray Mancozeb (0.25%) or Chlorothalonil (0.2%) every 7â€“10 days, rotate crops, and remove lower infected leaves.
remedies.Tomato_Late_blight: Apply Bordeaux mixture (1%) or Metalaxyl + Mancozeb (Ridomil Gold) 0.25% every 10 days; avoid overhead watering.
remedies.Tomato_Leaf_Mold: Ensure good ventilation, prune lower leaves, and spray Sulfur or Baking soda solution (1 tsp/L).
remedies.Tomato_Septoria_leaf_spot: Remove diseased leaves, spray Mancozeb (0.25%) or Chlorothalonil (0.2%) weekly, and use neem oil preventively.
remedies.Tomato__Spider_mites_Two_spotted_spider_: Spray neem oil (3%) or soap solution (2 mL/L) every 5 days; release predatory mites (Phytoseiulus persimilis).
remedies.Tomato__Target_Spot: Use Trichoderma viride in soil, spray Mancozeb (0.25%) or Chlorothalonil (0.2%), and avoid overhead irrigation.
remedies.Tomato__Tomato_YellowLeaf__Curl_Virus: Use yellow sticky traps to control whiteflies, spray neem oil (3%), and apply Imidacloprid (0.05%) soil drench; remove infected plants.
remedies.Tomato__Tomato_mosaic_virus: Uproot and destroy infected plants, disinfect tools (1% bleach), and control aphids/whiteflies using Imidacloprid or Thiamethoxam.
remedies.Tomato__healthy: Your plant is healthy! Maintain balanced watering, sunlight exposure, and apply organic compost regularly.
